availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elias Hubbard Smith (Grant County, KY, attorney)

body.p: Williamstown, Grant County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Sallie C. Oâ€™Hara Smith on July 11, 1850. Father of Helen M. Smith, Lucy R. Smith, Kate Smith, and James W. Smith. Clerk in Williamstown in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Williamstown in 1850. Attorney in Williamstown in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Williamstown in 1860. Attorney in Grant County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 360B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 7.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 990.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 9.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 001490815, p. 20.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Kentucky, 6th Congressional District, Vol. 3, June and July 1863, p. 229, p. 459 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com on March 30, 2020).
